message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ED, cs.IR 

This paper deals with Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods for identifying exercise item candidates from corpora, which falls under the category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the use of machine learning methods, which is a common topic in the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG). The selection criteria used in the framework also involve relevant features such as linguistic complexity and context dependence, which are important topics in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also focuses on the educational aspect of the system, which could be relevant to the sub-categories of Education (cs.ED) and Information Retrieval (cs.IR) as it involves the retrieval of relevant sentences from corpora for language learning exercises.
